com.pump.io.java

Class JavaEncoding

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.io.java.JavaEncoding

  • public class JavaEncoding
extends java.lang.Object
    Static methods related to reading and writing strings that use a \ character to escape characters.
    See Also:
    HTMLEncoding

      JavaEncoding()

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public static void encode(char ch,
                          java.lang.StringBuffer dest)
        Write a character to a StringBuffer. For example a tab character is written as "\t". If a character is not a simple recognized character, then it is written with unicode encoding ("ģ").
        Parameters:
        ch - the character to encode.
        dest - the StringBuffer to write to.

      • decode

        public static int decode(java.lang.CharSequence s,
                         int index,
                         java.lang.StringBuffer dest)
        Reads (or decodes) one character, such as "\\t" or "ሴ" or simply "x"
        Parameters:
        s - the String being read. This should NOT include the beginning/ending quotes.
        index - the index within s to start reading.
        dest - the buffer to write to. This may be null, in which case you won't be storing the parsed data (but you can still monitor the character index).
        Returns:
        the new index the next character should begin reading from. For example if the initial index is 0 for the String "x", then this returns 1 because the index only increased by 1 character. But if the initial index is 0 for the String "ģ", then this returns 6, so the cursor is positioned after the '3'.

      • encode

        public static java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String str)
        Encode a String using the Java conventions (using a \ character for special chars, including unicode identifiers.
        Parameters:
        str - a String to encode.
        Returns:
        a String that a Java compiler will accept. For example a tab character becomes "\t", or complex characters might use unicode encoding such as "ģ".

      • decode

        public static java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String string)
        Return a String previously encoded with encode(String)
        Parameters:
        string - a String using \ encoding.
        Returns:
        a String previously encoded with encode(String)
